quotes.quote: For materially less resourceful countries like Myanmar, the World Court is a vital refuge of international justice.

It cannot be ruled out that disproportionate force was used by members of the Defence Services in some cases in disregard of international humanitarian law, or that they did not distinguish clearly enough between ARSA fighters and civilians.
Can there be genocidal intent on the part of a state that actively investigates, prosecutes and punishes soldiers and officers who are accused of wrongdoing?
The peace of our world is indivisible. As long as negative forces are getting the better of positive forces anywhere, we are all at risk.

Although the sovereignty of the nation must derive from the people, there was terrible fraud in the voter list during the democratic general election which runs contrary to ensuring a stable democracy.
quotes.source: Military Statement on State of Emergency, February 2021

quotes.quote: Unless this problem is resolved, it will obstruct the path to democracy and it must therefore be resolved according to the law.
quotes.source: Military Statement on State of Emergency, February 2021

quotes.quote: Therefore, the state of emergency is declared in accordance with Article 417 of the 2008 constitution.
quotes.source: Military Statement on State of Emergency, February 2021

quotes.quote: Companies are currently having difficulties in international competition, and we will focus on minimising the difficulties they are experiencing in international competition and expanding their economic territory.
quotes.context: At meeting with business leaders, on trade & regulation support

quotes.quote: The economy is in a "desperate" situation.
quotes.context: In parliamentary address seeking approval for extra government spending

quotes.quote: I believe that between blood allies, we will be able to maintain the minimum amount of rationality.
quotes.context: On U.S.–South Korea trade talks, when asked if he would walk away

quotes.quote: The situation in the Middle East was "very urgent".
quotes.context: During a Memorial Day speech, relating to global stability

quotes.quote: There is concern that instability can arise in South Korea's foreign exchange market during the course of tariff negotiations with the U.S. but the two sides will be able to find a solution that ensures commercial rationality.
quotes.context: Speaking on FX market risks tied to ongoing tariff negotiations

quotes.quote: South Korea will find it hard to accept a deal where there is a major difference with that of Japan.
quotes.context: On comparing U.S.–Japan trade deal vs. Korea–U.S. deal

quotes.quote: I will implement a "bold" fiscal policy to boost a flagging economy.
quotes.context: On intentions for economic recovery after turmoil under prior administration

quotes.quote: The highest level of fines … will be imposed on serious violations of short-selling, with business suspension and trading restrictions.
quotes.context: Commenting on new financial regulation following his order

quotes.quote: The country needs to take measures to support its economy in the short term as it continues tariff talks with the U.S.
quotes.context: Comment by Lee via nomination of finance minister during trade negotiation period

quotes.quote: We will focus on easing regulations and accelerate working-level tariff talks with Washington as part of our broader support for companies on trade issues.
quotes.context: At meeting with top conglomerates on business & trade policy

quotes.quote: I urged officials on Monday to swiftly draw up a supplementary budget plan aimed at supporting economic recovery and spurring consumption.
quotes.context: Statement urging budget measures after taking office

quotes.quote: I vowed to end a "vicious cycle of unnecessary military tensions" with North Korea.
quotes.context: In speech to the UN, on his North Korea policy vision

quotes.quote: Without resolving the visa issue, meaningful progress remains virtually impossible.
quotes.context: On US investment projects stalling due to visa problems

quotes.quote: If the visa issue is not resolved, meaningful progress (of investments currently underway in Georgia) is virtually impossible … It is natural for workers and their families to be reluctant to re-enter the United States unless there is a firm guarantee of safety.
quotes.context: In detailed remarks on visa, US investment & worker safety

quotes.quote: In the face of unconstitutional and illegal martial law and civil war, our people … faithfully defended the law and order and protected democracy with their whole body.
quotes.context: At National Foundation Day ceremony, condemning martial law attempt

quotes.quote: The spirit of Hongik is shining more than ever … The government will produce results that the people can feel through practical solutions.
quotes.context: Same National Foundation Day remarks, invoking national ideals

quotes.quote: We tried to talk like President Trump, and President Trump’s way of talking is very terse and straightforward. We prepared a lot of scenarios on our own on how to answer this or that question.
quotes.context: On negotiation strategy with U.S. during trade talks

quotes.quote: I have attended universities in the United States, China and Korea … Through these experiences … if our universities focus on developing global competencies, Korean higher education could become a model that attracts attention worldwide.
quotes.context: At global conference on university competitiveness

quotes.quote: I believe that the reason Korean culture has come to be loved by people around the world, and why Korea’s democracy was able to overcome the martial law debacle, lies in the freedom and power of citizens, which all the journalists here have made efforts to protect as a shared value.
quotes.source: China Daily Asia / ANN reporting, October 2025
quotes.context: Speaking to Asia News Network — on role of media and democracy

quotes.quote: Information not accessible due to blocked sources
quotes.context: Multiple sources were blocked or inaccessible

quotes.quote: Information not accessible due to blocked sources
quotes.context: Multiple sources were blocked or inaccessible

quotes.quote: The two sides agree to effectively maintain information exchange and assessments regarding international developments, protect each other's legitimate interests in accordance with international law, including issues related to the East Sea and the sustainable use of the Mekong River's water resources.
Both sides affirm that the Vietnam-Laos relationship is an invaluable common asset of both nations that should be preserved, promoted and passed to future generations.
Cambodia will not join in endorsing any statement to support a judicial decision in regard of issues related to the South China Sea disputes, since Cambodia is taking a neutral position.

You are just fighting each other over South China Sea and then accused Cambodia of undermining [a joint statement]. So, please, those countries engaged in the disputes come and talk with each other while Cambodia would just choose to stay neutral on this issue.
Cambodia would not be a puppet of anybody on South China Sea issue.

We maintain diplomatic relations with countries across the globe. This is Cambodia's consistent political principle, based on respect for independence, sovereignty, and mutual benefit. I would like to reiterate that Cambodia is not a satellite of any nation.

While the Royal Government of Cambodia maintains strong ties with China, such cooperation reflects state-to-state relations... Cambodia's foreign policy remains grounded in engaging with all nations based on mutual respect for independence, sovereignty, and shared interests.
Cambodia retains full ownership of its domestic and foreign policy direction.

The world cannot be safe if any single person or country still suffers from this pandemic. Vietnam values the role of UN agencies and other multilateral institutions, particularly the COVAX Facility in promoting fair and equitable access to COVID-19 vaccines and medications.

Vietnam understands thoroughly the meaning of 'nothing is more precious than independence and freedom,' and of peace and development of each nation. Vietnam condemns all acts of war and power politics, and violations of the fundamental principles of the UN Charter and international law.

Vietnam shares ASEAN's position and the international community's common voice on the importance of peace, stability, maritime security and safety, freedom of navigation and overflight in the South China Sea.

We believe that all parties should refrain from unilateral actions that may further complicate the situation, resolve disputes and differences through peaceful means in line with the UN Charter and international law, particularly UNCLOS 1982.
ASEAN has agreed to persist in its role as a driving force for regional peace and stability, while also highlighting the Indo-Pacific's potential as a platform for collaboration.
Hence, ASEAN invites the United States to become a positive force to foster a peaceful, stable, and prosperous Indo-Pacific through tangible and inclusive cooperation.

A strong and sustainable partnership between ASEAN and the United States will definitely not only benefit ASEAN but also for the United States. Nevertheless, the partnership will only come to fruition with a strong commitment from both parties to uphold regional peace and stability.

Ever since the agreement was struck between Japan and the United States on July 22, Japan has given the utmost priority to continuing our efforts to coordinate the materialization of the reduction in tariffs on the U.S. side at the earliest possible time.
This has been based on my approach of 'investment over tariffs,' which I pushed for all throughout our negotiations.

Security in Europe and that in the Indo-Pacific are inseparable. We need to consider an impact not only on the security in Europe but also on the global security, including on the one in Indo-Pacific region, when the peace in Ukraine is to be achieved.
quotes.source: Written message for Ukraine Coalition Meeting, July 2024

quotes.quote: We can no longer deal with such situations with a mere extension of the existing security policy. It is impossible to deal with new threats, with the conventional paradigm based on traditional domains of land, sea and air.
quotes.source: Policy Speech to 198th Diet Session, January 2019

quotes.quote: Now is the time that we must raise the flag of free trade high. In such an era, it is our country's mission to expand an open and fair economic zone to the world.
quotes.source: Policy Speech to 198th Diet Session, January 2019

quotes.quote: We will make the vast seas and skies from the Indian Ocean to the Pacific Ocean the foundation of peace and prosperity from which every country, whether large or small, can benefit. Japan will create a 'free and open Indo-Pacific,' working together with all the countries that share this vision.
quotes.source: Policy Speech to 198th Diet Session, January 2019
quotes.context: On Free and Open Indo-Pacific vision

quotes.quote: Regarding the Murayama Statement, in the past, Japan caused tremendous damage and suffering to the people of many countries, particularly to those in Asian nations. This fully reflects the feelings of the Abe Cabinet.
Taiwan will not bend to pressure, but nor will it turn adventurist, even when it accumulates support from the international community.
China intends to replace the US and change the world's rules-based international order, and annexing Taiwan is just the first step.
Taiwan does not intend to counterattack the mainland, and does not intend to invade any country. Taiwan's drones are meant to protect our own nation and territory.

We have achieved an interim reduction in the tariff rate from 32 percent to 20 percent at this point in the negotiations, 20 percent was never our goal. We hope to work towards a more favorable and reasonable rate for Taiwan in the subsequent negotiations.
The story of Taiwan is one of resilience—of a country upholding democratic, progressive values while facing a constant challenge to its existence.

If Taiwan were to fall, the consequences would be catastrophic for regional peace and the democratic alliance system. It would signal that in today's global contest of values, authoritarianism has the upper hand over democracy.

Taiwan does not seek military confrontation. It hopes for peaceful, stable, predictable, and mutually beneficial coexistence with its neighbors. But if its democracy and way of life are threatened, Taiwan will do whatever it takes to defend itself.
Taiwan may be small in terms of territory, but it has proved that it can have a large global presence—and that this presence matters to the world.

xi_jinping.position: President, General Secretary of the CCP

quotes.quote: Western countries led by the United States have implemented all-round containment, encirclement and suppression of China.
quotes.context: On China-US relations and Western containment

quotes.quote: China can only do well when the world is doing well. When China does well, the world will get even better.
quotes.source: Belt and Road Forum Speech, October 2023

quotes.quote: What we stand against are unilateral sanctions, economic coercion and decoupling and supply chain disruption.
quotes.source: Belt and Road Forum Speech, October 2023

quotes.quote: The modernization we are pursuing is not for China alone, but for all developing countries through our joint efforts. Global modernization should be pursued to enhance peaceful development and mutually beneficial cooperation and bring prosperity to all.
quotes.source: Belt and Road Forum Speech, October 2023

quotes.quote: As member economies of APEC, we are accountable to our people and future generations to deliver sustained growth and prosperity.
Global and regional economic governance platforms such as APEC are geared towards averting conflict because sustained prosperity and progress are only possible in a world that is at peace.
We must leverage APEC's core value propositions as the premier regional forum in the Asia-Pacific, incubator of innovative ideas, pathfinder for collaborative solutions to emerging trade issues.

The race to sustainability comes with the risk of escalating protectionism. We must intensify capacity building, economic cooperation and technical assistance, knowledge and data sharing among our economies so that each is empowered and provided with the tools toward sustainable development.

We believe in leadership by example. If you can show that our system works very well for Malaysia, I think others might want to copy. No question of our preaching to them. We are not in a position to preach to our neighbors.
quotes.source: Council on Foreign Relations Interview, September 2018
quotes.context: On Malaysian diplomacy and regional leadership

quotes.quote: I think China has been there for the past four thousand years. It's difficult to get rid of China.
quotes.source: Council on Foreign Relations Interview, September 2018
quotes.context: On US-China trade tensions and China's resilience

quotes.quote: We have traded with China for nearly two thousand years... But China never conquered us. We have relations with Europe. The Portuguese came to Malaysia in 1509. Two years later, they came and conquered us. So I always feel that I'm safer with China than with Europe.
quotes.source: Council on Foreign Relations Interview, September 2018
quotes.context: On historical perspective on China relations vs Western powers

quotes.quote: Whether we like it or not, China is there and China is going to play a bigger role in world affairs. So one has to learn how to live with China. Malaysia has lived with China for two thousand years and we know a little bit about them, and we have survived.
quotes.source: Council on Foreign Relations Interview, September 2018
quotes.context: On pragmatic approach to China's rise

quotes.quote: Quotes not available from accessible sources
quotes.context: Limited access to recent speeches and statements

quotes.quote: There is no conflict between favouring Islamic and traditional values and being more open and international.
We should provide strong incentives for ASEAN businessmen to drive ASEAN forward and make it an attractive destination for foreign investors. ASEAN is the world's fourth largest trading entity.
I, as Sultan of Negara Brunei Darussalam, would endeavour to carry out the policies of my dear father, and would always safeguard and preserve the peace, tranquility and prosperity of the country.
We are still a little red dot, a bit redder, but still little. We are still in the middle of Southeast Asia, neighbours bigger than us, region prospering but troubled.
Today, your foreign policy and domestic policy, domestic situation has been linked together. So, we have to adapt to that, and our foreign policy has to adapt to that.
quotes.context: On evolving nature of foreign policy

quotes.quote: ASEAN is the raft which we are connected to, which gives us the platform for members, including us. It is really a cornerstone of Singapore's foreign policy.
Regional resilience for Southeast Asia means ASEAN. We have to keep on building this up, contributing to it and playing our part, even though we are a very small member of ASEAN.

Belt and Road Initiative and connectivity

notable_findings.mahathir_philosophical_approach: Emphasizes pragmatic realism, historical perspective, and non-interference principles
notable_findings.hassanal_bolkiah_governance: Balances Islamic values with international openness, focuses on ASEAN economic integration
regional_themes: Emphasis on economic development over ideology
